p:
Resistance to ganciclovir occurs most commonly in severely immunocompromised patients with prolonged exposure to the drug. The most common mechanism for ganciclovir resistance is UL97 gene mutation
71 ; this mutation leads to deficiency in the viral kinase that is necessary for the initial phosphorylation of ganciclovir into its active form. A less common mechanism is a mutation in the UL54 gene, which encodes for the CMV DNA polymerase.
